intro: Trichonema elongatum, commonly known as the slender thread moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, filamentous growth form and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a simple morphology with short, elongated shoots and small, closely spaced leaves. It lacks true leaves and instead has leaf-like structures called phyllidia. Trichonema elongatum plays a role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
